meanings.definition: resembling or characteristic of a myth
meanings.sent1: The ancient story had a mythy feel to it.
meanings.sent2: The book was filled with mythy tales of heroes and monsters.
meanings.sent3: The children enjoyed creating their own mythy adventures in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: Her explanation of the mysterious forest was so mythy, it felt like a dream.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the essence of a mythy world beautifully.

meanings.sent1: The museum displayed many mythy artifacts from ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent2: In literature class, we discussed the mythy origins of different cultures.
meanings.sent3: The movie's plot took a mythy turn when the protagonist discovered a hidden relic.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's storytelling was so engaging, it made the mythy tales come alive.
meanings.sent5: The play was a captivating blend of history and mythy legends.

meanings.sent1: The children's game involved exploring a mythy world of make-believe.
meanings.sent2: The author's new novel was set in a mythy realm filled with magical creatures.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke about a mythy creature had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: The dream felt so mythy, it was like stepping into a different reality.
meanings.sent5: The fantasy movie created a visually stunning mythy universe.
